channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CrowdStrike Outage Puts its Financial Reporting Under Scrutiny, Too
item.description: CrowdStrike’s preferred revenue measure looks especially dubious following its global mishap.

item.title: Universal Music Group, a massive holding of Bill Ackman, sees stock-price tumble on streaming worries
item.description: Shares in Universal Music Group, a big holding of Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square Capital Management, lost more than a quarter of its value on Thursday ...

item.title: An Increase in Uninsured Drivers Is Pushing Up Costs for Everyone Else
item.description: The number of drivers without car insurance has risen since the start of the pandemic, increasing the burden on everyone from other motorists to tow t...

item.title: Southwest Airlines to move ahead with assigned seating and premium seating options
Land of the Rising Banks
item.description: Japanese bank stocks have been on a roll and have more room to rise.

item.title: Here’s the one factor that can douse the benefits of stock buybacks, according to Morgan Stanley
item.description: A Morgan Stanley fund crunched the numbers on companies that do buybacks while awarding employees stock

item.title: Yen Hits Nearly Three-Month High on Expectations for BOJ Rate Hike
item.description: The yen strengthened sharply to a nearly three-month high against the dollar on Thursday, backed by growing expectations for an imminent rate increase...

item.title: Oil prices fall after another China rate cut underlines demand worries
item.description: Oil futures fell early Thursday after China’s central bank delivered another cut to rates, underlining worries about demand from the world’s second la...

item.title: Can Bill Ackman Turn Social-Media Stardom Into a Blockbuster IPO?
item.description: The billionaire investor is aiming to raise billions of dollars for a publicly traded fund next week.

item.title: Nestle and Unilever see share prices diverge on rival price hiking strategies
